p: The HIV-1 subtype B epidemic in Guatemala is mostly related to the B PANDEMIC clade (98.9%), as described for the majority of the Central [ 7, 8, 36], North, and South [ 3, 37] American countries. The proportion of Guatemalan HIV-1 subtype B viruses belonging to the B CAR clades (1.1%) was similar to the prevalence reported for Honduras, El Salvador, and Mexico (<1.1%) [ 37], but lower than the one reported in Panama (5.5%), the country where B CAR clade circulation was first demonstrated in Central America [ 8].
